Articles.Content:
[CENTER][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=6]Y[SIZE=5]ARG[/SIZE]J[SIZE=5]AY[/SIZE]9991's R[SIZE=5]EPLICA [/SIZE]C[SIZE=5]OLLECTION[/SIZE][/SIZE]
[IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_eaceae32e427436ebea24c52fb248a7a.png_650[/IMG][/FONT]
[SIZE=5][FONT=century gothic]

[B]Welcome to YargJay9991's Replica Collection.
[/B][/FONT][/SIZE][SIZE=4][FONT=century gothic]Please feel free to browse through my replicas and riplicas of real life aircraft.
What is a riplica? Well, it's an aircraft that is based on a real life aircraft, but is not an absolute copy of it. Take the Kerbus K380 below as an example.

[/FONT][FONT=century gothic]This thread used to be a company called J-Space Ind, but due to the removal of the Rocket Builders thread, it has now turned into my personal showcase thread. I will still keep the J-Space Ind logo up on this thread as it is sort of my signature that I add to all of my craft.
[/FONT]
[/SIZE][FONT=century gothic]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/FONT]

[FONT=century gothic][B][SIZE=6]CURRENT AIRCRAFT LIST[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]THESE ARE NOT UPDATED TO 1.0.5, AESTHETICS WILL BE OFF.
[/SIZE]PROCEED AT OWN RISK
[/B][/FONT][FONT=century gothic][B][SIZE=4]__________________________________________________________________________________
[/SIZE]
[/B][/FONT][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=5]Douglas DC-3 (TO BE UPDATED)[/SIZE]
[/FONT][SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=5]Ã¢â‚¬â€¹[SIZE=3]This [/SIZE][/SIZE][/FONT][SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic]beautiful[/FONT][FONT=century gothic] airplane is one of the most iconic and important aircraft in the history of aviation as it revolutionized the air transport industry. The DC-3 first entered active service in 1936 and is still used by many small regional airlines today. It was later converted into the C-47, the warhorse of the American Air Force during WWII.

[/FONT][/SIZE][/SIZE][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_31d7c169133d46a0ae4d56df24a212be.png_650[/IMG][SIZE=3][SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic]

[/FONT][/SIZE][/SIZE][URL="http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4862"][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_23e9ee1b24e04574aff55caabfde6bb2.png_256[/IMG][/URL][SIZE=3][SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic]

[/FONT][/SIZE][/SIZE][FONT=century gothic]ANY USEFUL INFORMATION ABOUT THIS AIRCRAFT IS MUCH [/FONT][FONT=century gothic]APPRECIATED.[/FONT]

[FONT=century gothic]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

[/FONT][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=5]Gee Bee Model R (UNTESTED IN 1.0.5)
[/SIZE][/FONT][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=3]The Gee Bee Model R has is an excellent aircraft for all of those classic aircraft collectors. It features innovative shock absorbing suspension on the main undercarriage for those rougher landings and boasts very life like flight characteristics.
[/SIZE][/FONT]
[IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_af4087aad9784abfb8f2a15a819ba66a.png_650[/IMG]
[URL="http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4861"][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_62e5152f864b450ca8c4fc6b09868b06.png_256[/IMG][/URL]
[FONT=century gothic]ANY USEFUL INFORMATION ABOUT THIS AIRCRAFT IS MUCH [/FONT][FONT=century gothic]APPRECIATED.[/FONT]
[FONT=century gothic]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/FONT][FONT=century gothic]
[SIZE=5]BAE Harrier GR7 Jump Jet (UNTESTED IN 1.0.5)
[/SIZE][/FONT][SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic]One of J-Space Industries' most recent creations, the famous Harrier Jump Jet has now been brought to the kerbal world. [/FONT][FONT=century gothic]With very realistic flight characteristics and excellent handling abilities, this beauty is a dream to fly.
The aircraft is (almost) exactly 1:1 scale compared to the real-life version.[/FONT][/SIZE]

[IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_8f60542225fc45f7a6c450c75739c4d3.png_650[/IMG]

[URL="http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4860"][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_8a1dd619dbf84af7ad9d1736826dec48.png_256[/IMG][/URL]
[FONT=century gothic]ANY USEFUL INFORMATION ABOUT THIS AIRCRAFT IS MUCH [/FONT][FONT=century gothic]APPRECIATED.[/FONT]
[FONT=century gothic]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/FONT]

[FONT=century gothic][SIZE=5]Koeing F/A-18 Hornet (STILL WORKS A BIT, WILL BE UPDATED)[/SIZE][/FONT]
[SIZE=3][FONT=century gothic]A large scale replica of the famous fighter.
COMPLETE WITH AFTER BURNERS[/FONT][/SIZE][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=3]
[/SIZE][/FONT][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_f1ccf8d6ad1346edb3d9566bcd637db2.png_650[/IMG]
[FONT=century gothic]
[/FONT][URL="http://kerbalx.com/crafts/2787"][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_dd425206a8834e7d87b29b5ceeb87e8d.png_256[/IMG][/URL]
[B]Action Groups[/B]:
1. Main Engines
2. Afterburners
3. Rear Spoiler
4. Flaps


[/CENTER]
[INDENT=5][B]Other Notes[/B][FONT=century gothic]: Don't use the afterburners for too long, they will make the main engines explode! (Just like the real thing)
[/FONT][/INDENT]
[CENTER][FONT=century gothic]_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/FONT][FONT=century gothic]

[/FONT][SIZE=5][FONT=century gothic]Kerbus K380 - 450 Kerbals (TO BE UPDATED)[/FONT][/SIZE]
[FONT=century gothic][SIZE=3]Need to carry an excessive amount of kerbals right now? Then the Kerbus K380 is for you!
This massive aircraft is a true marvel of engineering and weighs in at 322 tons.[/SIZE]
[/FONT][SIZE=4][FONT=century gothic][SIZE=3]Be careful how you use it though, she get's a bit fussy!
[/SIZE][/FONT][/SIZE][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_370b7a363ef748eca94b41a50198fdfa.png_650[/IMG][SIZE=4][FONT=century gothic]
[/FONT][/SIZE]
[URL="http://kerbalx.com/crafts/2784"][IMG]http://static.wixstatic.com/media/a6e281_2d87d2d5308b49a7a8f5abc8f188e1d3.png_256[/IMG][/URL]

WARNING!
It is recommended by J-Space Industries to have a fast computer in order to fly. 600 parts isn't healthy for school laptops.

LANDING NOTICE
When attempting a landing use very careful planning. A long approach is recommended and the only speed you can successfully land the K380 at is between 45 and 50 m/s.
[SIZE=-2][FONT=century gothic]

[/FONT][/SIZE]_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[SIZE=4]
